Document summary: This document outlines the Community-Based Renewable Energy Program (CBRE) Phase 1 structure and eligibility criteria for Hawaiian Electric customers. It details customer participation requirements, upfront payments, and monthly administration fees. Additionally, it covers developer participation conditions, site control, and financial aspects for creating CBRE Program Facilities.

This document is a submission to the Hawaii Public Utilities Commission regarding the Application of Kauai Island Utility Cooperative for approval of a Power Purchase Agreement with Kapaa Solar LLC. It includes amendments to the Interconnection Agreement and the Power Purchase Agreement. The document implies that the parties are finalizing details and procedures for the power interconnection and sale.
Suggested title v3: Kauai Island Utility Cooperative Application Update

Document summary: The document is an application for approval of a Power Purchase Agreement (PPA) between Hawaiian Electric Company, Inc. and Kalaeloa Solar Two, LLC for a solar photovoltaic energy facility in Hawaii. The PPA outlines the terms and conditions for the purchase of as-available energy, including pricing structures and interconnection requirements. The document details the competitive bidding process and regulatory considerations in line with Hawaii's energy policy goals.

This document is an application by Hawaiian Electric Company, Inc. seeking approval of a Power Purchase Agreement for a 45.9 MW solar project with Waiawa PV, LLC. The document highlights the requested approvals, importance of the project in meeting renewable energy goals, and details the financial impacts of the project in terms of accounting and projected costs.
Suggested title v3: Solar Power Purchase Agreement Request Dec. 2014

Document summary: This document is an application by Hawaiian Electric Company, seeking approval of a Power Purchase Agreement for Renewable Dispatchable Generation with Waiawa Phase 2 Solar, LLC. The PPA aims to provide flexible, semi-dispatchable renewable energy to the Hawaiian Electric system, supporting the state's 100% renewables goal by 2045.

This document is a Letter of Intent for a proposed solar energy project between HALEAKALA RANCH COMPANY and Clearway Renew LLC. The agreement outlines the negotiation and development of a 40 megawatt solar renewable energy project in response to Maui Electric Company, Limited's RFP. The document specifies key conditions such as lease agreements, entitlements, termination clauses, and confidentiality agreements.

This document outlines the current development stages and key details for solar projects in Chippewa Co, MI, and Cass & Adair Co, IA. The projects are in various stages of development, with pending next steps and incomplete PPA negotiations.
